articles.title: U.S. Federal Reserve revokes crypto guidance for banks

articles.title: Green Light: Banks Cleared to Support Bitcoin
articles.author: Ben Atlin
articles.summary: The Federal Reserve Board made a significant move on Thursday to simplify rules for banks engaging with cryptocurrencies and digital dollar tokens. In 2022, the Federal Reserve required banks under its oversight to notify it in advance if they planned to work with cryptocurrencies. This requirement has been eliminated, so banks can handle crypto activities without prior notification. The Fed will instead monitor these activities during routine bank examinations. The 2023 rule that required banks to get a formal 'nonobjection' approval was also scrapped.

articles.title: A Small Texas Town Takes on Crypto Noise Pollution
articles.summary: Danny Lakey, Karen Pearson, Nick Browning, and Virginia Browning live near the MARA bitcoin mine in Granbury, Texas. The mine uses a mix of liquid immersion and industrial fans to prevent over 20,000 computers from overheating. The noise from the fans is unbearable in the small town. Residents complain that their concerns are ignored by the company and government officials.

The launch of the coin sparked a major backlash and she vanished from social media at the end of 2024. The SEC closed its investigation into her. On 11 April, she reappeared on Instagram with a video showing her enjoying a European getaway.

articles.title: Fed Joins OCC, FDIC in Withdrawing Crypto Warnings for U.S. Banks

The industry is waiting for new laws to define how the digital assets industry should operate in the United States.

articles.title: Redo KYC before June 30: FIU tells crypto exchanges
articles.author: Anuradha Shukla
articles.summary: The Financial Intelligence Unit-India (FIU-IND) has directed cryptocurrency exchanges to enhance their Know Your Customer (KYC) processes by June 30 in accordance with provisions of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA). The FIU has asked exchanges registered with it to update all user details and initiate fresh KYC where details are older than 18 months. Binance, which was fined 18 crore last year by FIU for violating PMLA compliance, has sent mail to its existing users asking them to redo KYC process.

articles.title: The Fed withdraws its guidance on bank crypto-related activities
articles.author: Brady Dale
articles.summary: The Federal Reserve has withdrawn its supervisory letter on digital assets. It was the last of three prudential banking regulators to do so. President Trump committed on the campaign trail to roll back restrictions on banks seeking to engage in legal activities in the blockchain space. In 2022, the Fed issued guidance on how banks could engage in crypto-related activities, telling them to seek permission before opening such lines of business. In January 2023 the Fed, Office of the Comptroller of the Currency and FDIC issued a joint letter cautioning banks about such activities. The FDIC withdrew its letter in late March, and the OCC did so earlier in the month.

It's a cryptographic puzzle that lots of computational effort is required to solve, but it is easy to verify for anyone else.
